headline: Luscious Slush Punch
description: A perfect punch for kids and adults alike. This fruity, fizzy, slushy pineapple-strawberry punch recipe makes enough to refresh a big crowd.

video.description: See how to make a refreshing alcohol-free punch.
video.name: Luscious Slush Punch

name: Luscious Slush Punch
recipeIngredient: 2 (3 ounce) packages strawberry flavored Jell-O® mix
2 (2 liter) bottles lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage

recipeInstructions.text: Bring water, sugar, and strawberry-flavored gelatin to a boil in a large saucepan; boil for 3 minutes. Stir in pineapple juice, lemon juice, and orange juice.
Divide mixture into two separate containers and freeze.
Combine contents of 1 container frozen juice mixture with 1 bottle lemon-lime flavored carbonated beverage in a punch bowl; stir until slushy. Repeat with remaining portions as needed.

review.reviewBody: This is now a staple at our holiday events. Have made it at least 6 times. I do cut the sugar to about half.
Made it last Thanksgiving and it was a hit. Made 2 batches, one virgin and one spiked with tequila! A good time was had by one and all!! Some a little more than others.

Wow! Excellent slush punch. The taste is excellent and received rave reviews from my guests. One recommendation. Freeze in smaller quantities. I froze the mixture in 4 Tupperware containers. Set out the frozen slush to thaw a couple of hours before use. I used 1 liter of 7 up and 2 Tupperware containers for the first fill of the punch bowl. This is an excellent punch! Enjoy!
Awesome recipe! I’ve done it several times. Thank you!

I have made this recipe for years! 
First off, I follow the recipe by make these modifications. Instead of the lemon juice I add a can of frozen lemonade. I also add strawberries, blueberries, Sliced lemons and oranges (remove peel if you want), only use 1 1/2 c sugar. 
Use a large ladel to pour into gallon zip lock containers 2 is perfect I double line mine to prevent leaks! 
Other reviewers said it was completely frozen- it will be! You have to let thaw for around 3 hours before serving! If that still isn’t enough time put in microwave! You want it to be unthawed enough to take a fork/ knife and chop up in punch bowl to create a slush. Then pour your ginger ale, I got a flavored cranberry ginger ale and regular and plan on using both. The recipe is very flexible to your likes, so you can play around with flavors, ingredients, and fruit!
Easy to make and delicious!! Everyone asks me to bring this to get togethers. You won't be disappointed.
I didn’t make any changes to the recipe. I found it difficult to get the frozen mixture out of the container . I expected it to be a little slushier, and less of a solid block.
Maybe I did it wrong, but the jello became actual jello and just froze solid.
It was a bit sweet but still great!
This was delicious! The whole family loved it. I only made half of what it called for, and even that was a lot. Will definitely make this again!

I have made this recipe many times, and people always love it. However, I'm writing this review to let you all know about another version of it I discovered by accident. The last time I made it, I decided at the last minute (a few hours before the event) to make some extra in case the first batch wasn't enough. The problem was that I didn't have strawberry Jello or lemon lime soda on hand. I did, however, have some pineapple Jello and ginger ale, so I used that instead, and it was also VERY yummy. So, my point is that this recipe is totally delicious as written, but experimenting with different flavors can also give you great results.

A total hit! I made it just as the video indicated, placing it in 3 bags after cool down...about 1 hour. I placed 50 ounces in each bag, placed it in a 9x13 pan, and froze it. I added one 2 liter Publix lemon lime soda to the punch bowl. Everyone raved about it. It makes great frozen popsicles too.
a huge hit
Big hit at my Nee Year Day open house. Kids and adults alike kept going back.
Everyone loved this punch at Christmas Eve. I did decrease sugar to 1/2 cup which was plenty. If you want a refreshing, tasty, easy punch this is it.
I make this every Christmas Eve for our family gathering and it’s always a hit! So yummy!!
Made it for Thanksgiving and the entire family loved it. I have an extra batch in the freezer for another time.

This is requested by kids and adults!! It had such a good flavor. I use cherry jello instead of strawberry just because I prefer cherry. I’ve also used cherry-lemonade jello that I found in the summer. Easy to make. I also cut down the sugar by 1/2 cup and it’s still really sweet but good. You won’t be disappointed with this recipe!

I make this for EVERY event at work that requires punch. I don't have an option because everyone asks if they are getting "Kelly's Famous Punch" - even though I always send the link to this recipe when the ask! I decrease the sugar to about 3/4 cup at most because its definitely already sweet enough. I mix one recipe with a 2 Liter of Sprite and a 2 Liter of Gingerale. We never have leftovers.
Best punch recipe ever! My grandbabes love it!!!!

This punch turned out great. I also lessened the sugar to 1 1/4 c but followed the recipe otherwise. I used strawberry ginger ale which was delicious and to keep it cold and slushy, i added frozen strawberries. Lots of complements!

This punch is a definite favorite! I’ve taken it to family gatherings and work events, and everyone loves it! I followed other people’s advice about cutting the sugar down. I only use 1 cup of sugar and substitute plain seltzer water instead and of the citrus sodas.
Luscious!
This slush drink was amazing. I cut the sugar back and it was perfect. Thanks for a great recipe!

Way too sweet. If I make again I will omit the sugar and instead make a sugar syrup that can be added separately at the end to taste. Need to take the frozen mixture out of the freezer in plenty of time to melt enough to be able to thoroughly mix with the lemon-lime beverage.
Best punch I've ever tasted.You will love it and so will your guest.Never any left!
This punch was absolutely delicious!

Loved this recipe! Decided to make it again, with a twist and used cherry jello instead of strawberry (I prefer cherry to strawberry flavorings) and the used squirt/grapefruit soda with it instead of lemon-lime. It was a game changer! I love both recipes, but I tend to make it with a twist more often. I use it for every birthday/shower I host. This week I’m hosting a gender reveal, so I’m going to try following the recipe with a blue jello and a blue colored juice instead of orange juice so I can have two slush punches to represent both genders.

I always double this recipe so I have it on hand at a moments notice. It has been a hit at every party I have served it at. Beats the regular "cranberry punch" that everyone uses as a fall back. I have made it 3-4 times (doubled) and used it at over half a dozen functions. Sometimes it is a slush as it was meant to be sometimes it in mostly melted with small punch chunks still frozen and sometimes i need to keep it cold with ice. It has been a hit no matter how I serve it. Make it you won't be disappointed. Only change I made was I use Splenda instead of sugar. My best advise is just follow the recipe don't short cut somehow the chemical reaction of cooking the jello is the "it" factor. Delicious.
I made this for a reception of 600 people. Had tea and coffee but people drank this instead! Awesome. And I hate punch!!!
Hi, haven’t made this yet, would orange flavored jello work? I’m trying to find a punch for my son’s bday that’s not pink lol thanks!!
Great punch!

I have never written a review like this before but had to comment on this recipe. I first made it for a girls get together and was such a hit I made it for a Christmas party at work and quadrupled the recipe for 100 people. I see again for family Christmas and now the Super Bowl! It is so popular. Everyone Loves it. The only thing I’ve changed is Raspberry jello and sometimes lime juice instead of lemon and about 1/2 sugar. Best punch recipe ever and I know it by heart I’ve made it so much!
A most have at any party and so easy to do that my 12 yr. old son does it for me.
My family loves this recipe and been using it for years! We always make it on the weekend of the football playoffs and call it play off punch. Ten out of Ten recommend.

Very good using only 1 cup of sugar as other reviewers advised. No need for an ice ring because it’s already slushy & beautiful. Also great to mix with Prosecco! We served it at a family party and adults could spike their own as desired. This punch recipe is a keeper!

This was a hit at my Christmas party. While I am not a big fan of using Jell-o, I figured once a year is okay. I did only use 1 cup of sugar as others suggested and it was plenty sweet. I also probably only used about 3/4 a bottle of sprite for each half I made. We used watermelon infused vodka which made it sooo yummy! I would definitely make again.

I’ve made this many times as is for kids parties and it’s been a hit each time. This year for Christmas, I found cranberry jello and tried making it with that and both batches were gone! I had bottles of orange vodka and spiced rum on the side for the adults if they wanted. The orange vodka was perfect with the cranberry. It’s going to be a tradition from now on.

We have added this to our family Christmas Eve party for the last two years. Everyone loves it! If you live in a warmer area, sometimes traditional hot drinks just don't refresh you. This is fruity, festive, bubbly, and refreshing!

First off, I love it. I’ve made it at least 20 times since I’ve discover the recipe. The only thing I’ve modified is the sugar. Instead of 2.5 cups I reduce it to about 1 1/4. I’ve always made it this way after reading a few of the reviews and it comes out just the right amount of sweet with a tiny hint of tart.

I followed the directions given. It is awesome. Someone said it sounded like a lot of work. I found it easy and required very little time and effort. If anyone is interest I measured my liquid between the gallon size ziplock bags and it is 9 cups ( maybe slightly more) per bag. Hope that helps.
No changes made and I ended up making 3 batches! Thankfully I had reserves in the freezer.
Nah and yessir

Used one cup sugar and one box cherry one box strawberry. Just right! Thanks!

Ps. 1quart is 4cups or 1L and 46oz is 1.36L. Using one frozen can OJ with the 3 cans water to make 1.18L plus a 1L of pineapple juice is almost same and cools the mixture a lot faster
doubled this for a reception at my church... for half of this, I used champagne instead of lemon-lime soda....Well liked!
I made this for a progressive dinner. Everyone loved it! I will definitely make it again!
I have made this for many family gatherings and it is always loved by everyone.
Waaaaay to sour and bitter. Made this for Thanksgiving and the entire family HATED it!!!
Made it for my daughter's wedding reception. Everyone loved it!

Amazing! I made a triple batch for a reception for 200. !it was a hit! I used a second punch recipe so have about half of the base for this still in the freezer. Will pull it out for the next house party. I’m still sending the link to reception attendees.

I have never been a fan of fruit punch, but this was fantastic! I used 1 c. of sugar and thought it was perfect. I used 2 pitchers and froze 1/2 punch mixture in each pitcher. I took it out 1 1/2 hrs. before serving and added 7-up right away. I had to work at it a bit as it thawed, but it turned out perfectly slushy. It was served outside on a 90 degree day and stayed slushy until it was gone. Everyone loved it.
Guests liked it

It's good :-), it really does go fast. I did cut down on the sugar though. Made this during a work cookoff, and this actually won the drink category! Also was a hit during the past graduation party a month or so ago. It's good, because you can also make in advance.
I made for 25 servings, this was awesome, very yummy!

We make this regularly for parties and it’s always a hit with the kids. I usually freeze it in batches (ziplock bag in a loaf pan works great for portioning) and then mix each block with sprite or similar soda. Usually end up with four portions, and I also cut the sugar by at least one cup

I did a double batch for a big party...it was a big hit....no ice needed...I added one pineapple juice to the bottom of the 
Punch bowl with lemon lime soda.... Added one frozen bag....
Stir and it's ready...keep adding soda until the next frozen bag is needed...repeat...serves many guest!
I haven't made it yet...but this is going to be the ONLY punch recipe I ever use. Had it tonight at a gathering and made a pig of myself. Truly the BEST punch I have ever had!
The best punch Ever, and very easy to make, and it makes enough for a large gathering. I always reduce the sugar though by half. Way too sweet otherwise
Just made this for my son's birthday party and everyone loved it! There wasn't a drop left! I did cut the amount of sugar in half though.
This punch is delicious! Everyone loved it and asked me to bring it to the next family gathering.

Made it with 1.5 cups of sugar. Tasted delicious, everyone said so, but was not completely thawed in time. Made it and froze it the evening before my event. Got it out of the freezer an hour and a half before serving time. Mixed it with soda, which was cold, probably should not have been. After sitting out for a good 45 minutes, still not thawed enough to make a smooth slush, was a very chunky slush. Ended up adding 2 bottles of soda to one block of slush to get enough.

Delicious. I halved the recipe and it served 10+ at Book Club. I received many compliments. I also reduced the sugar to 3/4 for half a recipe (so 1.5 cups for a full recipe).

FYI, the full recipe gives 2.25 gallons or 9 quarts.

This really did not go well for me :) I made the punch portion before hand and froze it. 

When it came time to combine the frozen portion with the Sprite, nothing went well :) The frozen portion would not melt for ANYTHING. I ended up with slightly red-tinged Sprite and then an incredibly syrupy slush after a while.

This was very well received at our church function. I used 1 cup of sugar instead of 2.5 and it was the perfect amount of sweetness. I used 4 large Ziploc bags, filled them by lining a pitcher with a bag (it help to have 2 people do this part because the ziploc bag can slide down), and froze them on a cookie sheet overnight . Took them out 2 hours before serving. The first batch I did have to break into medium large sized pieces before putting in the punch bowl with the 7 up about 1 hour before service, and at service it just required taking a large spoon and breaking some of the pieces into smaller chunks and stirring. The second bowlful about 30-45 min later was perfect texture without doing anything. This will be my go to punch recipe. So easy because it is prepared ahead and everyone loved it!

It was great for a valentine church event. It was loved be all and three people wanted the recipe. It was very easy and great tasting punch!!!!! I added frozen strawberries, sliced and pureed. They added a festive flair to the punch.
I’ve brought this punch to a few parties and it always gets rave reviews.
Everyone loved It! They were all asking for the recipe. I cut the sugar down to 1 cup and it was perfect.

Made this for a baby shower and it was fantastic! I did cut the sugar to 1 1/4 cup and it was perfect. I froze it in two gallon-size bags and laid them flat to freeze. I ended up only using one so I have a bonus extra waiting in the freezer. I took it out a couple of hours before the party and the slushiness was perfect at party time. So easy!
This punch is a must have at all parties, Thanksgiving and any other event we have. Made as directed and it’s always a huge hit!!!!
This stuff is a HUGE hit every time I make it!
I've made this a few times, and we love the flavour, but definitely find we have to use A LOT less sugar. about 1 1/2 cups.

I just hosted an eclipse party, and this pretty, frothy, slushy punch was perfect for a hot summer afternoon. I found this recipe made exactly enough for two punch bowl sized batches. I cut way back on the sugar by using sugar free jello, only 1 cup sugar, and pouring over a two-liter of sugar free Squirt over each batch. It was perfect and definitely did not need to be sweeter. I made it days ahead and froze it in two gallon sized freezer bags which I stored flat in the freezer. On party day, I moved the frozen punch to the refrigerator for one hour and then thawed the first bag another hour on the counter. It was right at slush stage at that point and I added it to the punch bowl and poured over the Squirt. Since we had kids here, I served them the punch out of the bowl, but I added a shot of sparkling wine (you don't need to buy the expensive stuff since you're mixing) in the adult cups before pouring the slush punch over. Everybody LOVED the stuff. Not a drop left.

Rave reviews from our BBQ guests!
I took note of all of the sugar in the jello, soda and the natural sugar in the juices...2 1/2 cups of additional sugar seemed way over the top. I used a 1/2 cup (tops) of splenda ...next time I will try without any extra sugar at all. 
Its awesome - will be my go-to.
This is my 'go to' punch. It's the only punch I make and everyone loves it and complains that it runs out too fast! I cut the sugar in half and it is perfect! Thank you!
this punch is amazing. my daughter helped make it. I love how simple and easy it was, for her to help me.
Very good punch, making again to serve at my daughters wedding
Made this for a bridal shower and it was a BIG hit!
Great punch recipe I substituted raspberry jello and used gingerale. We did not think it was too sweet.

Very good. I reduced the sugar to 1 cup after reading other reviews and will reduce it even more in the future. The drink just doesn't need the sugar. I also used diet soda and no one could taste the difference. I made one batch with pineapple rum and triple sec and the other with no alcohol. Both were great!!
ALWAYS a hit with our guests!!! This punch is fabulous.

I have made this every Christmas for the last several years. It is always a big hit with my family and they now really look forward to it each year. I didn't change a thing. Love the slushy part of it.
The only punch I make. I reduce the sugar by 1/2 cup and use lime jello for the green color at Christmas and Cinco de Mayo. Perfect and goes fast!
I've made this so many times and everyone loves it, the only difference is I used Ginger Ale.
We have made this several times. My daughter just requested again for her New year's Eve Party. This is the best punch I've honestly ever tasted. This is our go to punch no doubt!

I have made this recipe countless times and everyone loves it. I tend to use a little less sugar because I think it is sweet enough, but other than that, I follow the recipe. Everyone (especially kids) loves the slushy part of the punch--including me!

We made this for the first time last year for a big family party and it was a MASSIVE success! We call it Jingle Juice for holiday parties! Definitely only add 1 CUP of sugar, I accidentally made it as written once and it was way too sweet.
Can the punch be served out of a beverage dispenser with a spigot at the bottom?
Keeps punch ice cold for the entire party.

I reduced the sugar to 1 and 1/2 cup, but I don't think the full amount would have been too sweet. Next time I'll try the full amount. I don't understand the lady who warned about the heat. I boiled (rolling boil) for 3 minutes then poured in room temp pineapple juice and it turned the mixture lukewarm. Added the cool OJ and lemon juice and poured it into two freezer bags. Into the freezer they went! The bags can be used in the microwave so the tiny bit of heat left in the punch was no problem. Can't wait to serve this "slushcious" punch for Halloween!! The video diluted the recipe by dividing it into three bags and using 3 (2 liter) bottles of soda. They also lost the luscious color!!
Wonderful! I did cut down on the sugar as others suggested.
Always a hit!

I used regular Sun Drop as the soda, and kept the sugar at 1 cup. Took this to a church function and it was so easy to pack up the frozen freezer bags and mixing ingredients. They drank every drop and wanted more!
It was very good. I only used 1 1/2 cups sugar
Used only 1 cup of sugar. It was plenty. Added a little coconut rum. Good!

I followed the recipe as stated with 2 modifications: I used vegetarian jelly (jello) mixes from the Mideast market instead of general supermarket jello mix which contains gelatin and isn't suitable for vegetarians/vegans or those who eat only halal or kosher products. And secondly, I used 1 cup of raw sugar rather than what the recipe calls for. For the lemon juice part, I hand-juiced about 3 large lemons to get the 2/3 cup. The frozen mixtures were pulled out of the freezer the morning of a baby shower and set on the counter to thaw for a few hours before going into a mason jar drink dispenser. I used Sprite lemon-lime soda. Really delicious! Everyone loved it.
So yummy! I made this for a fundraiser and it was very well received by parents and kids alike.

I have used this punch for every birthday party since my daughters second birthday (July 2012) It is to die for! Can anyone break it down for me to make half of the recipe? My daughter's turing 6 tomorrow and we're not having a big party like we usually do. I know I need to start it tonight but I'm exhausted. Her party is at 4pm central time tomorrow Saturday July 16th. So a quick response from someone would be great! Thank again for the best punch recipe ever!

I made this punch one time for an office party. Let me tell you it was a hit!! Now it's the only thing my co-workers want me to bring when we have a pot luck. I like that it makes enough for 2 bowls and I get to keep one batch to save for another time. Definitely recommend giving this a try.

This was fantastic! The flavor were a perfect mixture, without any need to alter the recipe. I chose this because it would satisfy a large group of people, and I'm so glad I did. Everyone enjoyed it and we still had more left over... it would probably be a good idea to get extra lemon-lime soda since people want to keep making more and more, and some also like the weaker strenth balance. I plan on making this over and over, whenever I have a large outdoor gathering, or in front of a fire during the winter. Thanks for this!
